1. What year did you start teaching in northern Canada? 1827.

There did you go to boarding school? 1827.

There had you been before that? Pennsylvania.

For how many people did you teach? Your own children.

How far was it to your nearest store? From your schoolhouse.

How often could a visit by mail to your family? Once or twice a month.

Did you ever travel by train? In those days? Never.

2. How much did you pay for flour? $1.50 per barrel.

For how much did you pay? $1.50.

How much did you save? $1.50.

What was the price for a twenty-pound bar of salt? $1.50.

What other goods did you use? Salt, flour, sugar.

17. Give a typical dinner and breakfast, dinner & supper for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and first three numbers of the family name at the time.

Breakfast - Oatmeal Porridge, Toast, coffee

Dinner - Dinner Plate, Butter Tea, beefsteak pie or pudding, bread, butter, fruit, cold meat, pancakes, fried beans, cornbread, applesauce, cake, birthday cake, two years ago.

18. That year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in eastern Indiana approximately at that time?

We served Turkey, Potatoes, gravy, cranberry sauce, plum pudding, Xmas cake, orange candy, nuts, cake in evening for the young ones pop corn.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation? Give details.
17. Give a typical day's meal (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, etc., etc.

Dinner - Dinner Plate, Gravy, vegetables, pie or pudding, bread, butter tea, coffee.

Pie or pudding, apple, bread, butter tea, coffee.
